data.text: @MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule @kipdemas @ODPP_KE The worst villain here though is SCORK. In 2019 we argued the Hussein Khalid and asked it to protect protesters rights including by revisiting the law used in this case. SCORK refused and sustained it. Parliament should review the law.

@MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule @kipdemas Perhaps it's @ODPP_KE we should discourage from pressing forward with such cases. It's clearly against the Prosecution and Diversion guidelines. And the cost benefits weigh against prosecution. Again, main DPP often reviews and withdraws such charges when requested to.

@MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule I think that, to her credit, the Magistate was 'reasonable' in ordering a non-custodial (6-month probation) sentence. The Act permitted her to give a year in jail: she didn't. I doubt she was completely oblivious of the free-speech issues arising cc @kipdemas. Probation is a win

@MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule I cannot access your DM.
Here is my email, joshuanya6@gmail.com

@MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule Great commentary
Do you have the ruling?
@MuthuriKathure @MUHURIkenya @fauma76 @article19eafric @article19org @cvoule Thank you for shaming the magistrate.
